Panela da Bahia, located in the Pelourinho has the best moqueca in Salvador. It is fantastic. Just order moqueca de camarao com banana, sit back, and enjoy yourself. It is next to Sankofa African Bar.

Go to Sankofa African Bar www.sankofabrasil.com. They have live music on Tuesday, Friday and Saturday. If you want to party with locals, this is the spot. It is located in the Pelourinho. Salsa night on Tuesday and Magary on Friday are memorable nights. It is truly not to be missed. The ambiance is friendly, fun, ecletic, hip and bohemian. It is located in a fantastic historic building.

Simply put, Serenbe is fool's gold.  You want to love the place and you really,really try. Everyone in Atlanta wants to love this place. But once you go, you kinda hate it- like, viscerally hate it.  At first glace it's beautiful and the idea is fantastic, but it just fails. The Inn is pitifully understaffed. The rooms are quite filthy. "Country Chic" it is not. "Sonoma of the South," borders fraudulent advertising.  I understand that it's a farm and that's part of the schtick, but I'd proffer that a zoo is fabulously aromatherapeutic in comparison. Food is average at best. There are some really great businesses in the community, go visit them, they're not to blame, just don't stay there.

Kathy from VT wrote :"If you feel the need to go into a bar with a gun then why go in?"

Because not all states differentiate between a bar and a restaurant. For example, in Virginia there are no such things as bars. There are only restaurants and restaurants that are licensed to sell alcohol. The later is considered a "bar".
Entering a "bar" in one of these states might juts mean getting a bite to eat at a place that also might have beer on the menu.

Now, having laws for allowing law-abiding concealed carry pistol permit holders to be allowed to enter these "bars" has implications that might not be readily apparent to people who have never owned a firearm. For one, you don't have to leave your gun (or have anyone notice) in the trunk/glove box of your car if you want to meet friends for dinner. Many a firearm have been stolen from cars. Also, there's also the potential for a negligent discharge when handling a firearm when it is not in its holster. Thus, it safer to leave you pistol in its holster, on your body, and go about your day.

Alas, just as the ignorant masses predicted "blood in the streets" over parking spaced when Florida became the first "Shall Issue" state, so are the same ignorant masses proclaiming the same will happen now.
